articles.title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
articles.description:
“As soon as somebody hits 20 home runs, I’m gonna give $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund.”

The post Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund for each player hitting 20 home runs in 2026.
This initiative directly supports cancer research and patient care in Boston.
The donation aims to engage Red Sox fans in supporting a local charity.

articles.title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
articles.description:
The "CHARLIE Act" would bar instruction about critical race theory and LGBTQ+ issues in classrooms.

The post N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: New Hampshire House advances the 'CHARLIE Act' to restrict school curriculum.
The bill prohibits teaching critical race theory and LGBTQ+ topics in public schools.
Boston educators may face challenges adapting to changes in neighboring state's education policies.

articles.title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
articles.description:
Drivers encounter the icy scene on Route 2 along the famous Hairpin Turn.

The post The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Drivers on Route 2 experience colorful icicles near Hairpin Turn in the Berkshires.
The icicles are a result of unique weather conditions impacting the area.
Local tourism may increase as visitors seek to see the scenic icicles.

articles.title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
articles.description:
While infectious, the Boston-area adult visited several locations where others were likely exposed to the virus, according to health officials.

The post Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston.
The infected adult visited multiple locations, risking exposure to others in the community.
Health officials urge Boston residents to check vaccination status to prevent further spread.

articles.title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
articles.description:
"She attended Gate of Heaven and became a familiar face in the neighborhood, from her early days at Dunkin’ Donuts—where she famously appeared in a commercial with Rob Gronkowski—to her time at Southie’s Own."

The post Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, passed away, leaving behind two children in South Boston.
She was a familiar face in the community, known for her Dunkin’ Donuts commercial with Rob Gronkowski.
Her death impacts local residents who cherished her contributions to the neighborhood.

articles.title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
articles.description:
"Every mile I run is for my dad, for his strength, his kindness, and his legacy. And every step forward is for a future where ALS no longer takes the people we love."

The post She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Lauren Hamilton is running the Boston Marathon to honor her father's legacy.
She supports The ALS Association, raising awareness for ALS research and support.
Her efforts aim to inspire Boston residents to contribute to ALS advocacy.
